title: Error when using TeacherForcing model for explainer due to the TeacherForcing __call__() taking 2 positional args
body:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "shaptest.py", line 41, in <module>
    shap_values = explainer(img, max_evals = 1300, batch_size = 10)
  File "/usr/bin/anaconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/shap-0.40.0-py3.8-linux-x86_64.egg/shap/explainers/_permutation.py", line 74, in __call__
    return super().__call__(
  File "/usr/bin/anaconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/shap-0.40.0-py3.8-linux-x86_64.egg/shap/explainers/_explainer.py", line 258, in __call__
    row_result = self.explain_row(
  File "/usr/bin/anaconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/shap-0.40.0-py3.8-linux-x86_64.egg/shap/explainers/_permutation.py", line 132, in explain_row
    outputs = fm(masks, zero_index=0, batch_size=batch_size)
  File "/usr/bin/anaconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/shap-0.40.0-py3.8-linux-x86_64.egg/shap/utils/_masked_model.py", line 57, in __call__
    return self._delta_masking_call(masks, zero_index=zero_index, batch_size=batch_size)
  File "/usr/bin/anaconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/shap-0.40.0-py3.8-linux-x86_64.egg/shap/utils/_masked_model.py", line 199, in _delta_masking_call
    outputs = self.model(*subset_masked_inputs)
TypeError: __call__() missing 1 required positional argument: 'Y'
```

this shows the __call__() fxn missing pos arg Y, the only function in the code base using it is _teacher_forcing.py in models.

it is quite possible I am wrong, but with some bash automated searching through the code and the stack trace, it seems like a pretty good shot
